questions.stem: The derivative of sin²x is:
questions.explanation: Using chain rule: d/dx(sin²x) = 2sin x · d/dx(sin x) = 2sin x cos x

questions.stem: For what value of x is log₂x = 3?
questions.explanation: If log₂x = 3, then 2³ = x, therefore x = 8

questions.stem: The period of tan x is:
questions.explanation: Tangent function repeats every π radians, unlike sin and cos which repeat every 2π

questions.stem: The value of i⁴ is:
The solution set of |x - 2| = 3 is:
questions.explanation: |x - 2| = 3 means x - 2 = 3 or x - 2 = -3, giving x = 5 or x = -1

questions.stem: The domain of √(1 - x²) is:
questions.explanation: For real values, 1 - x² ≥ 0, solving gives -1 ≤ x ≤ 1

questions.stem: If A and B are events with P(A) = 0.5 and P(B) = 0.3, then maximum value of P(A∩B) is:
questions.explanation: Maximum value of P(A∩B) is minimum of P(A) and P(B), which is 0.3

questions.stem: The sum of complex numbers z and its conjugate z̄ is:
questions.explanation: If z = a + bi, then z̄ = a - bi, so z + z̄ = 2a = 2Re(z)

questions.stem: The derivative of e^x is:
questions.explanation: e^x is unique in that it's its own derivative

questions.stem: In binomial expansion of (1+x)ⁿ, the coefficient of x^r is:
questions.explanation: The coefficient of x^r in (1+x)ⁿ is nCr = n!/(r!(n-r)!)

questions.stem: The equation of circle with center (2,3) and radius 4 is:
questions.explanation: Standard form (x-h)² + (y-k)² = r² where (h,k) is center and r is radius

questions.stem: If sin θ = 3/5, then cos θ equals:
questions.explanation: Using sin²θ + cos²θ = 1, if sin θ = 3/5, then cos θ = ±4/5. Given angle in first quadrant, cos θ = 4/5

questions.stem: The sum of first n natural numbers is:
questions.explanation: Sum = n(n+1)/2 is the arithmetic series formula for first n natural numbers

questions.stem: The range of function f(x) = sin²x + cos²x is:
questions.explanation: sin²x + cos²x = 1 for all x, so range is singleton set {1}

questions.stem: If f'(x) > 0 for all x in an interval, then f(x) is:
questions.explanation: Positive derivative throughout an interval implies function is strictly increasing

questions.stem: The inverse of function f(x) = 2^x is:
questions.explanation: f⁻¹(x) = log₂x as it satisfies f(f⁻¹(x)) = x

questions.stem: The equation ax² + bx + c = 0 has equal roots if:
questions.explanation: Discriminant b² - 4ac = 0 for equal roots

questions.stem: ∫ cos x dx equals:
questions.explanation: The integral of cos x is sin x + C as d/dx(sin x) = cos x

questions.stem: The probability of complement of event A is:
questions.explanation: P(A') = 1 - P(A) where A' is complement of A

questions.stem: The equation of line passing through points (1,2) and (3,6) is:
questions.explanation: Using point-slope form with slope = (6-2)/(3-1) = 2
